content.body: the fact that it's one of the GH emoji reaction set has never made any sense to me; there is no facial expression that means "I have seen this", because that's literally not an emotion
I think it has to be wide eyed, to make it clear that it's not "I am suspicious of this"
content.formatted_body: I think it has to be wide eyed, to make it clear that it's not "I am suspicious of this"

content.body: FWIW I've typically seen ğŸ‘€ used to indicate "looking". E.g. for PRs indicating a comment is being looked at / worked on. Which I've assumed is why GitHub included them in their emoji reactions.
indeed. I understand it logically but it doesn't make sense visually
actually, ğŸ‘ï¸ would be just fine
because that's "watching"
which is close enough to "looking"

content.body: Oh we currently have a PR with something very similar to that, but I was annoyed by the fact that it doesn't clean up the gh-pages folder once the PR gets merged/closed.
ah
yeah we're pushing to AWS I think
I recommend simply deciding not to care about the contents of the gh-pages folder
but that said it would be pretty easy to have an another action to clean it up for you with https://github.com/marketplace/actions/github-list-pull-requests
(or whatever)
